qas.question: When did the seven companies begin developing USB's?
What was the goal for USB's?

answers.text: to make it fundamentally easier to connect external devices to PCs

qas.question: Who was included in a team that worked on the standard at Intel?

context: A group of <a1_0>seven<a1_0/> companies began the development of USB in <a0_0>1994<a0_0/>: Compaq, DEC, IBM, Intel, Microsoft, NEC, and Nortel. The goal was <a2_0>to make it fundamentally easier to connect external devices to PCs<a2_0/> by replacing the multitude of connectors at the back of PCs, addressing the usability issues of existing interfaces, and simplifying software configuration of all devices connected to USB, as well as permitting greater data rates for external devices. A team including <a3_0>Ajay Bhatt<a3_0/> worked on the standard at Intel; the first integrated circuits supporting USB were produced by Intel in 1995.
